classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D2, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Electives (8). Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). No POLS class may be taken to fulfill Upper-Division D. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any POLS Major Course (300-400 level elective) can go here. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.
